page.title: 03DESCRIPTION OF SURVEY AREA
page.content: 1.THE AREA IS A PENEPLAIRED SURFACE WITH A CONCORDANCE AT 80M, DIS- SECTED BY VALLEYS DRAINING TO THE FAL OR TO THE SEA. 2. TREGONY, THE MAIN SETTLEMENT IS A FORMER MEDIEVAL PORT AND ROTTEN BOROUGH. SCATTERED HAMLETS AND ISOLATED FARMS ARE A DISTINGUISHING FEATURE. OF FARM, THERE ARE 17, ALL OF OLD FOUNDATION AND FIVE MORE WHOSE LAND OVERLAPS THE STUDY AREA. 3. ONLY TREGONY IS SERVED BY A DAILY BUS. ELSEWHERE PRIVATE TRANSPORT IS VITAL.TREGONY SUPPLIES CONVENIENCE GOODS AND POSTAL NEEDS. TRURO IS THE MAIN SHOPPING CENTRE. MOST ROADS ARE MINOR, AND ARE VERY NARROW. 4. SINCE 1963 TELEGRAPH AND ELECTRICAL SERVICES HAVE REACHED ALL ISOLATED AREAS. 5. DAIRYING IS THE PRIMARY, SHEEP AND BEEFCATTLE IS THE SECONDARY FARMING
